page.title: 07HEGGLIE BER JETTY.
page.content: {Hegglie Ber Jetty}is a small concrete structure measuring 3m 35 cm in length,2m 20cm in width and 3.5m in height.There are 27 steps leading down to it.It is built on the{south west side of Sanday,{opposite}the{Calf of {Eday,}a neighbouring island. It was{built}in{1980}by Lesley Wilson, a local builder, and John Sinclair. It {cost}about{Â£2000}to build, and although very{rarely used now,}it is still used to transport the{vet to {and from Eday.}It was also sometimes used to bring{tourists}to the island during the{summer}and the short journey takes place in the midst of some of the most{spectacular scenery on Sanday. But during the{winter}and even in the summer, due to the meeting of many different tides,{very strong currents often{prevent mooring of boats.
